title: Quiz 2: Feb 2022 FQE
description: Final Qualifying Examination - February 2022. Covers Access GUI operations, query design, HTML basics, and Excel features.

questions.question: In Ms Access, how can you create relationship between two tables in the GUI?

options.text: Drag the foreign key of a table into the primary key of another table
Drag any field from parent table and drop on child table
Drag the primary key of a table into foreign key of another table
Any of these can be done to create relationship

questions.explanation: To create a relationship in Microsoft Access, you typically drag the Primary Key field from the parent table (the 'one' side) and drop it onto the corresponding Foreign Key field in the child table (the 'many' side) within the Relationships window.
questions.hint: You connect the unique identifier from the parent to the reference in the child.

questions.question: The small button with three dots displayed at the right of field properties box is called
questions.explanation: The button with three dots (...) is known as the Build button. Clicking it opens the Expression Builder or other relevant property builders depending on the property selected.
questions.hint: It helps you 'build' an expression or mask.

questions.question: The amend center of access file that appears when we create or open the Ms Access database file is called?
questions.explanation: In older versions of Access, the main container that appeared upon opening a database was called the Database Window. In newer versions, this is the Navigation Pane.
questions.hint: The main window showing all database objects.

questions.question: How can you define a field so that when entering data, ##### is displayed?
questions.explanation: The Input Mask property controls how data is entered and displayed. Setting it to 'Password' causes characters to display as asterisks or other masking characters.
questions.hint: It 'masks' the input.

questions.question: In which method we don't need to specify the field type while creating a new table?
questions.explanation: When you create a table by simply entering data (often in Datasheet View), Access automatically guesses and assigns the data type based on the value you type.
questions.hint: Access guesses the type based on what you type.

questions.question: What does the show check box in query design window indicate?

options.text: It indicates whether the field is to be used or not
It indicates whether the field is to be displayed in query result or not
It indicates whether the field name is to be displayed in query result or not
It indicates whether the field is to be used for grouping results or not

questions.explanation: The 'Show' checkbox in the query design grid determines visibility. You might want to include a field to filter results (Criteria) but hide it from the final output.
questions.hint: To see or not to see the column in the results.

questions.question: Which of the following option creates a Drop Down list of values?
questions.explanation: The Lookup Wizard is used to create a field that allows you to choose values from another table or a custom list, typically presented as a drop-down combo box.
questions.hint: It helps you 'look up' values.

questions.question: Which kind of query displays its own dialogue box prompting you for entering information before executing?
questions.explanation: A Parameter Query is designed to be flexible; it pauses execution to ask the user for input (criteria) via a dialog box.
questions.hint: It accepts parameters at runtime.

questions.question: Which operator is used to filter and display rows when all (two or more) conditions are Satisfied?
questions.explanation: The AND operator requires that ALL connected conditions must be true for the record to be selected.
questions.hint: This AND that must both be true.

questions.question: The upper part of the query design window in Ms Access has two parts shows;
questions.explanation: The upper pane of the Query Design window displays the Tables (showing field names) and the Relationships (join lines) between them.
questions.hint: It shows the tables and the lines connecting them.

questions.question: Which feature is used to duplicate a control formatting?
questions.explanation: While the specific tool is called the Format Painter, using it involves changing the mouse pointer to apply the format. Among the options, Pointer is the closest reference to the action.
questions.hint: Think of the Format Painter tool.

questions.question: Database locking refer to?

options.text: Preventing two individual from changing the same data at the same time
Using a password to prevent unauthorized access
Preventing accidents delete by using password lock
Ensuring data is not lost before exiting database

questions.explanation: Record locking is a mechanism used in multi-user databases to prevent data inconsistencies (concurrency control) by ensuring only one user can edit a record at a time.
questions.hint: It prevents conflicts when multiple users edit data.

questions.question: How do you make data field DOB to store the dates like '2002/10/15'?

options.text: By entering dates in yyyy, mm, dd order
By setting the format property to 'yyyy/mm/dd'
By setting the input mask property to 'yyyy/mm/dd'
By allowing access to pick date from calendar option

questions.explanation: The Format property determines how data is displayed. Setting it to 'yyyy/mm/dd' ensures dates appear in that specific order.
questions.hint: This property controls the 'look' of the data.

questions.question: Which of the following data type is more commonly called Boolean?
questions.explanation: A Boolean data type represents two states: True or False. In Access, this is the Yes/No data type.
questions.hint: Binary logic: 0 or 1, Yes or No.

questions.question: Which linking code can be used to link a web page to kmtc.ac.ke?
questions.explanation: Option D follows the closest syntax for an HTML anchor tag: Link Text, despite the typo 'AHREF' in the question options.
questions.hint: The tag is 'a' and the attribute is 'href'.

questions.question: Step by step instructions written to solve any problem is called
questions.explanation: An algorithm is a finite sequence of well-defined instructions to solve a specific problem or perform a computation.
questions.hint: A recipe for solving a problem.

questions.question: DHCP severs provides --- to the client?
questions.explanation: DHCP (Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol) servers automatically assign IP addresses (network addresses) to clients on a network.
questions.hint: It gives your computer an IP.

questions.question: Which one of the following is a html tag
questions.explanation:
is the standard opening tag for a paragraph.
is also a tag, but

is the primary example of a container tag. is invalid syntax.
questions.hint: Used for Paragraphs.

questions.question: Which attribute in html language is used to embed an image in a HTML page?
questions.explanation: The tag used to embed an image is .
questions.hint: Short for image.

questions.question: What feature will one use to apply motion effects in between a slide exits and another enters?
questions.explanation: Slide Transitions are the motion effects that occur when you move from one slide to the next during a presentation.
questions.hint: Moving from one slide to another.

questions.question: Step by step instructions written to solve any problem is called
questions.explanation: An algorithm is the logical sequence of steps to solve a problem. Pseudocode is a representation, but the core concept is the algorithm.
questions.hint: Repeated question: A recipe for solving a problem.

questions.question: A set of rules that govern all aspects of information communication is called
questions.explanation: A protocol is a standard set of rules that allow electronic devices to communicate with each other.
questions.hint: Like a language or etiquette for computers.

questions.question: Computer memory is measured in terms of
questions.explanation: The Byte is the fundamental unit of measurement for computer memory storage.
questions.hint: 8 bits make one of these.

questions.question: What type of chart is useful comparing values over categories?
questions.explanation: A Column chart (or Bar chart) is specifically designed to compare values across different categories.
questions.hint: Vertical bars comparing items.

questions.question: A feature in Excel that displays only the data in column(s) according to specific criteria
questions.explanation: Filtering allows you to display only the rows that meet certain criteria, hiding the rest.
questions.hint: Like a coffee filter, it keeps what you want and removes the rest.

questions.question: The greater than sign (>) is an example of --- operator
questions.explanation: Comparison operators like > result in a boolean value (True/False) and are categorized as logical or comparison operators.
questions.hint: It tests logic: True or False.

questions.question: An Excel file is generally called a/an
questions.explanation: An Excel file (.xlsx) contains multiple worksheets and is collectively called a Workbook.
questions.hint: It contains multiple sheets.

questions.question: When a row of data is to be converted into columns

options.text: Copy the cells in row, select the same number of cells in row and paste
Copy the cells in column then choose paste special, then click transpose and ok
Copy the cells then go to cell then on alignment tab click transpose check box and click ok
Select the cells then place the cell pointer on new cell and choose paste special mark transpose check box and click ok

questions.explanation: The Transpose feature in Paste Special rotates data from rows to columns or vice versa.
questions.hint: The feature is called 'Transpose'.

questions.question: Which bar show the used formulas of selected active cells?
questions.explanation: The Formula Bar located above the worksheet grid displays the content or formula of the currently selected cell.
questions.hint: It shows the formula.

questions.question: ________ is the process of finding errors and fixing them within a program
questions.explanation: Debugging is the process of detecting and correcting errors in software code.
questions.hint: Removing bugs.
